ai.summary: Dormans Park Walk (SCC) is a challenging 19.1 km hike in the United Kingdom intended for experienced walkers seeking a strenuous day out, with a route that weaves through Dormans Park and surrounding countryside across mixed terrains.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of parkland paths, rural footways and variable surfaces. Surfaces may be uneven, grassy, muddy and gravelly, with sections of gentle ascents and potential steeper stretches; footwear should be sturdy and waterproof.
ai.safety_notes: This is a long, hard hike; plan for 19.1 km of exertion. Check weather and daylight; start early in winter. Carry maps and a compass or GPS, a charged phone, and a means of signaling. Bring sufficient water and energy snacks; wear layered clothing and waterproofs. Stay on marked paths, watch for mud and livestock, and let someone know your route and expected finish time.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring, Summer and Autumn; winter hikes are possible with extra gear and caution

seo.title: Dormans Park Walk (SCC) – 19.1 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the 19.1 km Dormans Park Walk (SCC), a challenging UK hike. Find terrain details, safety tips, recommended gear, and best seasons for this demanding route.
